Charades: Players act out words or phrases without speaking while others guess.
Pictionary: Players draw pictures to represent words or phrases while others guess.
Taboo: Players try to describe a word or phrase without using certain "taboo" words.
Two Truths and a Lie: Players share two true statements and one false statement about themselves, and others try to guess the lie.
Mafia/Werewolf: A social deduction game where players try to identify the "mafia" or "werewolves" among them.
Scattergories: Players come up with words that fit specific categories, starting with a given letter.
The Human Knot: Players stand in a circle, reach across and grab hands with different people, then work together to untangle themselves without letting go.
Heads Up!: A charades-style game where players hold a phone or card to their forehead, guessing the word or phrase based on clues from others.
Trivia Night: Players form teams and answer questions from various categories to test their knowledge.

Duck, Duck, Goose: Players sit in a circle and one person walks around, tapping others on the head, saying "duck." They eventually tap someone and say "goose," and that person has to chase them around the circle.
